snippet: Newspapers like Haaretz and Maariv are being squeezed by the pressures of the global digital age and a small, crowded Hebrew-language market that is undergoing convulsions of its own.
abstract: Memo From Jerusalem; Israel’s print media is in crisis, squeezed by both global pressures of digital age and small, crowded Hebrew-language market that is undergoing convulsions of its own; media experts speak of ominous trend in which once-diverse news bazaar is becoming more concentrated and prone to political influence.
lead_paragraph: Newspapers like Haaretz and Maariv are being squeezed by the pressures of the global digital age and a small, crowded Hebrew-language market that is undergoing convulsions of its own.

headline.seo: Concentration and Politics Hinder Israel Newspapers
headline.main: Political and Market Forces Hobble Israel’s Pack of Ink-Stained Watchdogs
headline.print_headline: Political and Market Forces Hobble Israel’s Pack of Ink-Stained Watchdogs
